comment: Some classmates were were salty cuz they expected the grade to handed to them. Not the case. Read & follow the Syllabus and do the work and you will pass. There is a lot to learn and she is willing to help if you put in work. It is a large workload but it is manageable. She is understanding if you are honest. She can see through bull.

Put in A quality work ethic and you'll pass. Follow the rubrics and read your textbooks. Don't skip class or you'll miss out on a lot of information. Not high school so put in the work and its an easy A. Fair grader.

Would take her again. She works to make you the best teacher possible and doesn't take half-assed work. She gets you ready for the real word. BE SURE TO BUY THE TEXTBOOK & READ. Follow the syllabus and rubrics and its an easy A. Grades aren't just handed to you so come ready to work.

Fair grader. Works with you when needed. Do your work and you'll pass. show up to class, pay attention, and read the textbook. She's down to earth and has a lot for students to take away from the course.

She's pretty nice once you get to know her, she is stern and expects the best from you at all times. Most definitely a class that you have to read and do the work in. Works with you when you're struggling. If you pay attention and follow the rubrics you can do well in the course. Don't take if you're not willing to do the work.

Professor Bell was the realest teacher I've ever taken for education. If you put forth your best foot, you can pass easily. Follow the syllabus and read the textbooks. She gives tough love but you're better because of it. Super willing to work with you and overall the course is easy to get an 'A' in if you do the work.

Show up to class and pay attention and you'll do well. Be ready to work and turn in assignments that are A worthy. She pulls for the best in her students and if you're willing to give 100% she'll help you out. Her husband normally teaches the course. Gets you ready for real life, don't skip class. Would definitely take her again.

She was down to earth and real. Most definitely has a lot to give students that are willing to learn. She prepares students for the real world and what it takes for a student to pass in graduate school. I learned a lot and would take her again. READ SYLLABUS AND TEXTBOOK. If you pay attention in class you can pass easily.

Do not take her at all cost! She cannot teach a college course to save her life. She demands for projects to be turned in at a certain time and does not give back grades until weeks later. Two weeks before the end of the course, she decides to go out of the country where no one can reach her via email. Take Abercrombie instead!!!
Awful, no idea how to teach a college course. For such an in depth course taking her is a terrible decision.

By far the worst teacher I have had in the education field. If you have a choice, do not take her. She is a very tough grader and doesn't look at others people's reasoning besides her own. Her husband teaches the course most of the time and she stands behind her desk. DO NOT TAKE HER! Projects are ridiculous.

DO NOT TAKE! Her husband is the one who actually teaches the class for the most part and she stands in the corner. He is the one who does all the modules. She will say that their are no due dates but then turn around and say something is due that weekend. She makes you really think about your projects and won't really help you. Not organized.
